content.question: Acid <math alttext="H I O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HIO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="H B r O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HBrO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="H C l O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HClO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> Each particle diagram shown is a representation of an aqueous solution of one of the acids listed in the table. The molarity of the acids in the solutions is the same. Based on the information, which particle diagram best corresponds to the indicated acid?

choices.label: Diagram 1 corresponds to <math alttext="H C l O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HClO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Diagram 2 corresponds to <math alttext="H C l O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HClO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Diagram 2 corresponds to <math alttext="H I O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HIO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
Diagram 3 corresponds to <math alttext="H B r O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HBrO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Diagram 2 corresponds to <math alttext="H I O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HIO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

topic.text: 8.6: Molecular Structure of Acids and Bases

skill.text: 6.C: Support a claim with evidence from representations or models at the particulate level, such as the structure of atoms and/or molecules.
